author: Staff Reporter
text:
K. Ramadoss, a prominent social worker in the city, who strove for improving the civic infrastructure in north Chennai, passed away on Wednesday.

He was 75 years old.

A resident of Ayanavaram, he died of a heart attack at a private hospital. He had donated his eyes to Sankara Nethralaya.

Govindaraj of Exnora International said Mr. Ramadoss was writing letters to newspapers on various issues till even a week ago.

He is survived by his wife and daughter.
title: Veteran social worker dead
